question: [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_borrow_box()] [Error recovery attack] After borrow_global fails with NOT_FOUND, is the GlobalValue left in a corrupted state that could cause subsequent operations to behave incorrectly? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: serialize()] [None serialization] When serialize returns Ok(None), does this properly abort the transaction, or can it cause partial state updates where some changes persist and others don't? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_destroy_empty_box()] [TODO comment security] The TODO on line 628 suggests uncertainty about table creation - can this indicate a potential bypass where tables are destroyed without proper initialization checks? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: deserialize()] [None deserialization] When deserialize returns Ok(None), can this cause uninitialized or corrupted values to be used, leading to undefined behavior? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: into_change_set()] [Change ordering attack] Can an attacker manipulate the order of changes in the BTreeMap to cause operations to be applied in an incorrect order, breaking atomicity guarantees? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: into_change_set()] [Partial change set] If serialization fails mid-way through change set generation, are the successfully serialized changes rolled back, or do partial updates persist causing state corruption? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: into_change_set()] [Op::New vs Op::Modify confusion] Can an attacker manipulate GlobalValue state to incorrectly classify operations as New instead of Modify (or vice versa), bypassing existence checks or causing data loss? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: into_change_set()] [Op::Delete tracking] Does Op::Delete properly handle cases where a value was added and then deleted in the same transaction, or can this cause ghost entries or state inconsistencies? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: into_change_set()] [Empty entries optimization] The check for !entries.is_empty() skips empty change sets - can this hide the fact that a table was accessed but not modified, causing issues with access tracking or auditing? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: TableChangeSet] [New table tracking bypass] Can an attacker create tables that are not properly recorded in new_tables, causing the storage layer to be unaware of new tables and fail to initialize them correctly? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: TableChangeSet] [Removed table resurrection] If a table is in both removed_tables and has entries in changes, does this cause undefined behavior where a table is simultaneously destroyed and modified? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: into_change_set()] [Bytes conversion] When converting serialized data to Bytes with .into(), can this cause unnecessary copies or memory issues with large table entries? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_destroy_empty_box()] [Non-empty destruction] Does the function properly verify the table is actually empty before destroying, or can an attacker destroy tables containing data, causing permanent data loss? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_destroy_empty_box()] [Double destruction] Can the same table be destroyed multiple times by adding it to removed_tables repeatedly, causing assertion failures or state corruption? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_drop_unchecked_box()] [Resource leak] When a table is dropped unchecked, are its resources properly released, or can this cause memory leaks, storage leaks, or resource exhaustion? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_destroy_empty_box()] [Assert failure DoS] The assert on line 631 for removed_tables.insert - can an attacker trigger assertion failure by destroying the same table twice, crashing validators? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/extensions/move-table-extension/src/lib.rs] [Function: TableData::new_tables] [Table count limit] Is there a maximum limit on the number of tables that can be created, or can an attacker create unlimited tables to exhaust storage or memory? (Medium)
